name: NormalDataBuilder
comment: Contains functions for generating normals for arbitrary mesh data.

build.name: build
build.comment:
Uses the index data and positions to compute the vertex lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.normals.

To compute the normal for a vertex the lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.indices are used to access the lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.positions that make up a triangle face. The face normal is then computed and added to the value contained in lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.normals. As a final step the values within lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.normals are themselves normalized.

It is assumed that the indices in the range \indexOffset .. indexOffset + indexCount refer only to vertices within the range \[[vertexOffset], .. [vertexOffset] + [vertexCount]\]. No checks are done to ensure this. This is to remove the cost of determining the vertex range.

It is also assumed that the values within lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.normals are all set to (0, 0, 0). If this is not the case the values within lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.build.normals will be incorrect.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of lithium_ion/lithium_mesh.NormalDataBuilder.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
